topic_page.title: Injury & Healing

intro.what_this_topic_means: This topic covers peptides discussed in injury recovery contexts: tendon/ligament, muscle strains, wound healing, and inflammation modulation.
common_misconceptions: Animal healing results do not guarantee human healing outcomes.
Faster pain reduction is not the same as better tissue healing.
Unregulated sourcing and non-medical administration can dominate real-world risk.
who_should_be_extra_cautious: Adolescents (growth and repair setpoints still calibrating)
People with clotting disorders or on anticoagulants (context-dependent)
People with autoimmune disease or chronic inflammatory conditions

how_to_use_this_page: This page is educational, not prescriptive.
Approval status and evidence grade matter more than popularity.
If risk is high and evidence is weak, uncertainty is part of the hazard.

peptides.why_people_look_it_up: Often searched for injury recovery; evidence is largely preclinical and product identity may vary.

safety_callouts.title: Route and sourcing drive risk
safety_callouts.body: For recovery peptides, many real-world harms relate to contamination, dosing uncertainty, and non-medical injection practices—not only the molecule.

evidence_notes.title: Healing outcomes are hard to measure
evidence_notes.body: High-quality studies require imaging, validated function scores, and long follow-up. Be cautious with claims based only on anecdotes.
